input: Imagine a self-contained, hypothetical world with only the following conditions, and without any unmentioned factors or causal relationships: Having a brother has a direct effect on skill. Skill has a direct effect on salary. Method 1: We look at how having a brother correlates with salary case by case according to skill. Method 2: We look directly at how having a brother correlates with salary in general. To understand how having a brother affects salary, is it more correct to use the Method 1 than Method 2?
